author: Business Insider
description:
Nearly 80 years of nuclear waste in the US is currently stranded — stuck in "temporary" storage sites without a permanent place to go. How big of a problem is this? And could recycling this waste solve the problem?

Business Insider producer Elizabeth McCauley sifts through the noise and talks to experts to find out the truth.

Check out this reading list to view the sources that informed this video: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1u5BXCAdzlTz3OK4woI8aOMLcY6ZapeDfsccKaja9bpg/edit?usp=sharing

00:00 - Intro
01:21 - What is nuclear waste?
02:51 - How much is there?
03:31 - The solution: deep geological repositories
04:06 - How temporary storage works
04:54 - Risks of temporary storage
07:55 - San Onofre Nuclear Power Plant
08:07 - Fukushima disaster
09:12 - How the Onkalo deep geological repository works
 11:15 - History of nuclear waste in the US
12:41 - Yucca Mountain, Nevada repository debacle
14:41 - Why Americans are paying for nuclear waste
17:11 - How nuclear waste recycling
title: You're Being Lied To About Nuclear Waste
